alert.note: Alert for Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 9:37PM EDT until July 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain slowly diminishing across the area. Although additional flooding is unlikely, it take awhile longer for any flood waters to diminish. Be alert for water covering roadways. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Yemassee, Hendersonville, Early Branch, Islandton, White Hall, Ruffin, McPhersonville, Cummings, Pocotaligo, Salkehatchie, Davidson, Blountville, Blake, Stokes, Bells Crossroads, Rhodes Crossroads, Fechtig, Colleton Medical Center and Barkerville.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
